intro: Biscutella picroides, commonly known as the yellow biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial that produces small, yellow flowers in early spring. The plant has fleshy, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with mustard-like flowers. Biscutella picroides is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to thrive in harsh, dry conditions.
